intro: Polemonium robustum, commonly known as the showy lady's slipper, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It features upright, hairy stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, woodland habitats and prefers partial to full shade. Its showy blooms make it a popular choice for native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
